title: Battery percentage in OSD
body:
I think it would be a good feature to be able to display the battery percentage based on voltage only. Voltage is more actual than using capacity which has to be fine tuned to actually work and can handle multiple battery sizes.

So the implementation that I am thinking about would be to use the current voltage, the value for the minimum cell voltage and the value of the voltage at startup as maximum since it's always somewhat lower than the maximum cell voltage. I also think some kind of averaging over a small timeframe would be needed to handle fluctuation in voltage and have more consistent display.

title: New Actual Rates model : set rates in deg/s, independently of each other
body:
This PR proposes the introduction of a new method for configuring Rates, based on ideas I've had for quite a long time.  Big THANK YOU to IllusionFPV for providing me with the impetus to actually do something, and for his coding assistance.

The classic Betaflight rates model uses three 8 bit parameters:

- rcRrate, which returns a linear relationship between stick position and rate, such that the maximum rate in deg/s, at full stick, is 200 times the Configurator value (twice the CLI number).

- SRate, which exponentially increases the preceding linear rate as the sticks move out from centre. It has little or no effect at centre position. The inflexion point of the curve cannot be changed.  Adding more SRate will make for a steeper looking curve because the maximum rate increases a lot at maximum stick deflection.  An SRate value of 0.5 in Configurator (50 in CLI) will double the rate at maximum stick position.

- Expo, which adds a second 'curve' on top of the preceding values, with greater effect around centre stick position, and no effect on maximum rate.  The inflexion point of the curve is a bit different from the SRate curve, and changes with the amount of expo.  An expo value of 0.5 in Configurator will flatten the rate curve around centre stick by a factor of 2x, but will not change maximum rate.

When we configure our rates, we primarily care about three things:

- centre stick 'sensitivity', or, how 'twitchy' is the centre stick responsiveness?  Technically, this is determined by the rate change of rate per unit stick deflection around centre position.  

- the maximum roll rate at full stick deflection, i.e., how fast will it spin when we do a flip.

- how quickly the responsiveness changes as we move the stick from centre to full deflection, or 'expo inflexion point', meaning, whether the change in responsiveness increases steadily and smoothly as the sticks move further out (low expo, as used by racers), or whether we get a wide range of relatively low responsiveness and then a sudden increase at max rates (high expo, as often used in freestyle).  

While Betaflight rates have been around a long time, the method has some drawbacks:

- cannot set centre sensitivity or max rate in degrees/s
- each parameter interacts with another in terms of its effect
- limited control over the expo transition point
- weird config numbers that don't directly relate to outcomes
- config numbers that are different in CLI and Configurator

This summarises the interactions between Betaflight rate settings and outcomes:

- centre 'sensitivity' is affected by both rcRate and expo
- max roll rate is affected by both rcRate and SRate
- expo inflexion point is affected by both SRate and expo

This PR proposes the eventual replacement of the current Betaflight rates configuration paradigm with a different method.  The goals are:

- let the user set centre sensitivity, max roll rate and expo inflexion directly
- ensure that value is independent of any other
- set centre sensitivity and max roll rate in deg/s
- ultimately, show the same number in CLI and Configurator (requires 16bit values)

The way the code works is:

- first, use the value for 'centre sensitivity' to directly configure a 'baseline' linear response to stick movement.  The value entered for 'centre sensitivity' represents the actual stick sensitivity at centre in degrees/sec. The number entered is the centre 'feel' you'd get for a linear rate configured at the set deg/s.  This is the kind of 'base' responsiveness.

- let the user set their desired max turn rate in deg/s, and make a 'wedge shaped' linear ramp of the extra rate amount, above baseline, that is needed to get to that max rate at full deflection.

- apply an expo factor that changes the inflexion point of that ramped quantity from nearly linear to rising sharply at extreme stick deflection.  

Ideally, the centre sensitivity and max rate would be entered directly as deg/s.  For example, a freestyle setup might be centre sensitivity of 120 deg/s and max rate of 800 deg/s, and a race setup might range from 150 to 500.  In this PR, I have to re-use the rcRate and Rate 8 bit values.

To enter values as per this PR, we have to use 8 bit numbers, as follows:

- Centre sensitivity: for 150, set rcRate to 1.5 in Configurator,  or 150 in CLI.
- Max Rate: for 800, set SRate to 0.8 in Configurator, or 80 in CLI.
- Expo: set the same as before.  0.5 in Configurator, or 50 in CLI.

To determine your current centre sensitivity from the classic Betaflight rates:

- if you have no expo, it is rcRate * 200
- if you ave expo, it is rcRate * 200, attenuatedby (1-expo). 

So if you had an rcRate of 0.75 and no expo, your current centre sensitivity is 150.  If you have rcRate of 1.0, and 0.5 of expo, your current centre sensitivity is 100.

Your max rate is shown by the Rates curve in Configurator.

Once you know your current centre sensitivity and max rate, you can switch to the new `ACTUAL` rates method, and enter these values directly.

The new expo factor is a true inflexion point curve adjustment, and can't be directly translated from any previous Betaflight settings since they have complex interactions.  A starting value of 0.5 is fairly typical.  When set to 0, the stick responsiveness changes more smoothly than is possible currently.  When set to 1, the expo is quite extreme.  

Note that changing expo will not change your centre sensitivity or your max rate.  Centre feel will differ with low expo because we get a greater increase in rates around centre than with higher expo, but the actual dead centre sensititity to fine inputs will not change.

title: Support RCC_ClockCmd and RCC_ResetCmd for HAL
body: `RCC_ClockCmd` (and `RCC_ResetCmd`) is now properly supported for HAL based targets (F7, H7 and G4), and peripheral clock enabling were removed from startup procedure. Should save some power.

title: Move targets into legacy targets for 4.1.6.
Added dterm configurable expo curve to MSP
Frsky_X spi rx jitter MATEKF411RX (BetaFPV F4 1s board)
body:
Frsky_X on build 2071 has a bad jitter not present on build 1947. Almost feels like too high P but dropping it doesn't help, suspecting micro failsafes. Only fix is to bind D8 using Frsky_D and it is back to smooth.

Flash build 1947 and use SPI RX/Frsky_X, no issues with flight, then flash build 2071 with SPI RX/Frsky_X, massive amounts of oscillations.

I'd expect build 2071 to fly the same as 1947 with SPI RX/Frsky_X. Diff below of what I flew build 1947 on and same diff I used on 2071 (minus changing PID loop to 4k)

title: Add FF Interpolate options to MSP
body: Added `ff_interpolate_sp` `ff_smooth_factor` and `ff_boost` to MSP API 1.43. Working on it to add these configurable parameters in to `Pid Controller Settings`  Betaflight Configurator tab.

title: Add ACC calibration stick command help to OSD boot splash screen when calibration is needed
body:
Adds the stick commands to calibrate the ACC whenever the `NO_ACC_CAL` arming disabled is active.

![osd_splash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17088539/73986441-a0d4f400-490b-11ea-8f40-7df8616d6baf.png)

If the ACC calibration is not required then the splash screen reverts to only showing the stick commands to enter the CMS.

title: Alternative low voltage and capacity warnings
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Some pilots prefer a minimal OSD, yet still need to know when the battery is about to die. Warning elements are good, but you have to remember at what voltage they are set, and they don't tell much apart from that the limit has been reached or exceeded.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Inspired by #9454, have a way to display voltage or used capacity with the warning element.
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Hide the voltage / used capacity elements after arming, until alarms have been reached. 

To be clear, this is in addition to how it works now, not a replacement. A CLI set command is sufficient.

title: omnibusf4sd (v2 Pro) unable to map LED strip to PPM
body:
**Describe the bug**
OmnibusF4 v2 pro is unable to drive LED strip through dedicated LED connector pin (HW design bug). At the same time, my PPM header is unused. I'd like to use this header to drive my LED strip. After unmapping PPM a PWM 1 resource from PPM header (PB8), mapping LED_STRIP to B8, saving and configuring LED strip, there is no output on PPM pin (checked with oscilloscope). When I try to map LED strip pin to any motor output (and remove motor resource from that pin), LED signal is there. I've also verified physical connection from PPM pin to PB8 on STM32F405RG.
[Schematic of newer version here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/b4hq3ikyu77gejm/OmnibusF4-Pro-Sch.pdf).

Is there something hidden preventing LED_STRIP assignment to PPM(unmapped) pin?

**To Reproduce**
 - Try to configure LED strip to PPM header (remap resource)
 - Nothing on PPM pin (even when you try to remap MOTOR 1 there)
 - only constant 0.7V on pin

**Expected behavior**
 - led strip driving signal appears on PPM pin

**Flight controller configuration**
```
# diff

# version
# Betaflight / STM32F405 (S405) 4.1.3 Jan 16 2020 / 11:34:00 (543a5e1ba) MSP API: 1.42
# manufacturer_id: AIRB   board_name: OMNIBUSF4SD   custom defaults: YES

# start the command batch
batch start

board_name OMNIBUSF4SD
manufacturer_id AIRB

# name: ORION

# resources
resource PPM 1 NONE
resource PWM 1 NONE
resource LED_STRIP 1 B08

# feature
feature TELEMETRY
feature LED_STRIP

# beacon
beacon RX_LOST
beacon RX_SET

# serial
serial 2 32 115200 57600 0 115200

# led
led 0 0,0::C:2
led 1 0,1::C:2
led 2 0,2::C:2
led 3 0,3::C:2
led 4 0,4::C:2
led 5 0,5::C:2
led 6 0,6::C:2
led 7 0,7::C:2
led 8 0,8::C:2
led 9 0,9::C:2

# master
set serialrx_provider = SBUS
set motor_pwm_protocol = DSHOT600
set align_board_yaw = 270
set small_angle = 30
set pid_process_denom = 1
set gyro_1_align_yaw = 2700
set name = ORION

profile 0

rateprofile 0

# end the command batch
batch end
```

**Setup / Versions**

 - Other components [RX, VTX, brand / model for all of them, firmware version where applicable];
 - how are the different components wired up.

**Additional context**
Tested on 2 identical boards with same result.

title: BF 4.1.X Smart Audio Not Communicating with TBS Pro Nano 5G8
body:
Really not sure if this is a hardware issue or a software fault, so I'm looking for answers everywhere. It's sounding more and more like the latter the longer I look into it.

**Describe the Bug**
Brand new [Pyrodrone F412 AIO flight controller](https://pyrodrone.com/collections/flight-controllers/products/pyrodrone-aio-412t-fc-esc-aio) refuses to talk to a [Team Blacksheep Unify Pro Nano 5G8 video transmitter](https://pyrodrone.com/collections/vtx/products/tbs-unify-pro-nano-5g8). FC uses Matek F411 as flashing target. 

**To Reproduce**
Connect VTX to TX pad on UART 2. Flash with 4.1.X (none work). Load VTX table for Smart Audio 2.0. Power on quad, notice that VTX Tables page indicates "no" device ready, and Smart Audio debug under sensors returns all zeros.

**Flight Controller Configuration**
- VTX Connected to TX pad on UART 2
- Port 2 is configured for TBS Smart Audio
- FC uses Matek F411 target
- Tried 4.1.3 primarily, but issue persists in 4.1.0 and 4.1.1 as well.
- Loaded with SA version 2.0 VTX table (as specified in TBS manual)

**Additional Context**
- The VTX works--when I power up, LEDs do turn on on the VTX and I do get a video signal, but Betaflight still doesn't see the VTX.
- I've tried 4.1.0, 4.1.1 and 4.1.3 on both the Matek F411 Legacy and MTKS targets. 
- I've tried re-soldering my wire connections.
- The TBS Manual actually says the VTX uses SA 2.0 LITE, but there isn't a VTX table for that, and the manual also states that 2.0 and 2.0 LITE are functionally the same.
-As stated above, SmartAudio debug in blackbox returns all zeros, indicating FC is either receiving no signal from VTX or isn't interpreting signal properly.
-Images below are what I see in my goggles when going through the OSD menu. (Apologies for bad quality, but it's kind of hard to get a good picture of a tiny goggle screen using a large phone.)
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60676686/73799946-00e96000-477d-11ea-98a1-18064aeb4ddc.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60676686/73799951-047ce700-477d-11ea-9893-af18f5ace5b5.png)

title: CRSF Telemetry not reporting remaining capacity
body:
Using an X9D to display telemetry from a crossfire module, the discovered sensors include RxBt, Curr and Capa corresponding to sensor IDs 0008/1, 0008/2 and 0008/3 respectively. 

crsf.c defines the telemetry data sent to be:

```
/*
0x08 Battery sensor
Payload:
uint16_t    Voltage ( mV * 100 )
uint16_t    Current ( mA * 100 )
uint24_t    Fuel ( drawn mAh )
uint8_t     Battery remaining ( percent )
*/
```

I've attempted manually creating a 0008/4 sensor to pick up the ```Battery remaining``` value, but it doesn't receive any data.

I am seeing the same on a number of quads. Is this an issue with the data being transmitted by the ```crsfFrameBatterySensor()``` routine (which looks OK to me!) or the Crossfire LUA script running on the transmitter?

title: Just a question not a feature
body:
I'm building my own flight controller and software for my aerospace degree and wanted to know if the flight controllers like betaflight, KISS etc. hold there angle at a setpoint or if they only try to stop unwanted rotations when in Acro mode.
So if say they have a set orientation that the pilot can rotate and the flight controller tries to hold this set rotation so if it say hits a branch and the quad spins if it will completely return to the original rotation or if the quad only controls rotational speed.

Sorry if I'm posting this in the wrong place. I don't know where else to ask this.

title: millivoltosd no telemetry and voltage info
body:
Hi,
I'm using the revoltosd firmware on my millivoltosd FC.  I'm also using a spark32 4in1 with blheli32 and rxsr fport with access firmware.  

It seems like telemetry is not working at all and the fc itself is not even getting any voltage information from the esc.   Is there a different firmware I should be using?

It seems like smart audio and all other rx related control is working.

Here is my diff:

# master
set acc_hardware = NONE
set serialrx_provider = FPORT

set blackbox_device = NONE
set min_throttle = 1070
set dshot_idle_value = 350
set dshot_bidir = ON

title: BMP280 not visible on TMOTOR F7 HD
body:
**Describe the bug**
The barometer can not be activated on the TMOTOR F7 HD. The Barometer is connected to the SDA and SCL pins. Power is also connected as expected 3.3V and GND (I also tried on 5V) 

**To Reproduce**
After connecting the barometer i activated in from the configuration tab and then executed the following commands:
```
set baro_bustype = I2C
set baro_hardware = BMP280
save
```
**Expected behavior**
The barometer should work. 

**Flight controller configuration**
```

# Betaflight / STM32F7X2 (S7X2) 4.1.3 Jan 16 2020 / 11:35:53 (543a5e1ba) MSP API: 1.42

title: Battery profile future request

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body:
Hi!

I am recently experimenting with liion on a 6'' quad, but I have the following issue:
I have to manually adjust the warning voltage eachi time I am switching in between so the liion will not continuously beep on lipo settings.

Looking around I have seen that inav has a great future that lets you switch by stick, cli, or lua up the 3 battery profiles.

The profiles look like the one bellow:
battery_profile 1
set vbat_scale = 1100
set vbat_max_cell_voltage = 430
set vbat_warning_cell_voltage = 340
set vbat_min_cell_voltage = 330

Also the 3 profiles can be automatically rotated depending on input voltage for instance.

Would it be possible to add something like this to betaflight also.

Thank you!

title: Slow / stuttering OSD Element refresh rate Betaflieght 4.1.3
body:
**Describe the bug**
The refresh rate of the OSD Elements slow down and stuttering a lot.
The first half of a Lipo pack round every second the OSD Values will refresh. Second half of the pack the "Battery current draw" will slow down and "Battery current mAh draw will make huge steps from 550mAh to 1030mAh in one step. Current and used mAh are precisely.

**To Reproduce**
With every pack i got the same result. I flew 4 pack around me near by ang got the same Issue.

**Expected behavior**
I expect the same fine steps / refresh rate like in the first half of the pack.

**Flight controller configuration**
```

title: Automatic ARM without flipping the switch
body:
I have assembled my drone and everything seemed to work fine without the propellers but later when I put propellers on and the drone was ready to fly I put it on the floor while my crossfire and taranis remote control was connected to the receiver but but everything was off meaning not armed and the moment when I put the drone on the floor the props start to spin and my finger is cut into pieces really bad (3 stiches). I'm just wondering if anyone had ever such a problem because this is very scary and I cannot trust it anymore. I'm sure  I had set up everything correctly (it's my fourth quad) but I cannot understand why did this happen. 

Thanks for any help.

title: Please add support for I2C interfaced RTC (real time clock) like PCF85263

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body: The addition of a driver for an I2C interfaced RTC to the system would be great.  Some suggested devices are preferably the PCF85263, MCP7941x, etc. A reliable battery backed clock which has the actual time and date is a nice addon!

title: Please add driver for Infineon DPS310 barometer.

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body: The DPS310 has been out for a couple of years and is an advanced barometris pressure sensor. It has a capacitive sensor rather than a resistive sensor like most ubiquitous barometric sensors (MS5611, BMP280, etc). The capacitive sensor is immune to light sensitivity unlike the resistive sensors. In addition, they have a higher resolution and accuracy.

title: Please add driver for the Bosch BMM150.

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body: The BMM150 compass is a solid component, and it has been around for some time yet it is not supported. Would be nice to have.

title: Please add a driver for the Memsic MMC5883A compass

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body: The Memsic MMC5883A is an advanced version of the ubiquitous HMC5883. It is a newer state-of-the art component. It has much higher data rate capability. However, it's register set is a bit different than the HMC part; similar just uses different locations.

title: PPM limitation 12 channels

labels.name: Inactive
labels.description: Automatically detected and labeled, will be closed after another week of inactivity.

body:
Hi,

Why PPM frame is limited to 12 channels, it is not consistent with iNav and very disturbing ?

#define MAX_SUPPORTED_RC_PPM_CHANNEL_COUNT 12

Possible to set 16 channels ?

title: Altitude limitation
body:
Helo,

In Europe a new law will ask our quad to limit the maximum altitude. Is it possible to manage this request with Betaflight (for example limit throttle) ?

title: SPRACINGH7EXTREME external current measurement via ADC  pad
body:
Hi,

first of all, thanks for this great software!
Im having the following problem, Im not able to make the current sensing work on my SPRACINGH7EXTREME FC. 

I'm using the following hardware.
FC: SPRACINGH7EXTREME 
ESC: T-Motor F55A PRO 6S 4IN1 32bit

The main battery plug is connected to the ESC and the current sensing output of the ESC is connected to the ADC pad of the flight controller. The resources are set to default (resource ADC_CURR 1 C00)
The current meter source is set to "Onboard ADC". If i plug in the power supply the measured value is 1.18A (power supply shows 0.37A) but if i just keep the USB cable plugged in, the value shows 15.86A.
The 1.18A value does not change even if the motors are spinning.

I did the following tests (ESC current sensor unplugged from ADC pad).
1. Plugged in the power supply (15V) and increased the motor speed until the PS showed 1A
-- the voltage of the ESC current sensor output was at 33,4mV
2. increased the motor speed even more until the PS showed 2A
-- the voltage of the ESC current sensor increased to 84,2mV

I have found the following information on t-motors product page "Amp monitoring port with the amperage of 15.2mV/A...", that would not make sense compared to my measurements.

Did i understand something wrong? Maybe I have to change the resource?

One additional thing that i have noticed is that if the PS is plugged in there is a voltage of about 64mV on the ADC pad (current sensor not connected).

Full dump of my configuration --> https://pastebin.com/5dn25hDR

Thanks for Your help

title: Display calculated deg/sec when editing P/R/Y rate rc/super values

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body:
I always have to reconnect to a computer to adjust rates, since i like to see what the deg/sec is.

The OSD rc & super rate editing screen should show the deg/sec value while adjusting.

Also i'd be nice if the OSD could show them in a similar table like on configurator instead of the vertical menu, i.e:

`editing RATEPROFILE 1`
`.AXIS.   RC      SPR    EXP  d/s`
`.ROLL:   120  45  5   533`
`PITCH:  120  45  5   533`
`..YAW:     120  45  5   533`
`back`
`save & exit`

then the tx sticks could easily move around the table

title: FPV Camera Angle Compensation -Enhancement

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: Feature requests are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body:
The current implementation of FPV Camera Angle Compensation does a pretty good job of correcting for the visual perceptual error created by tilting the camera.  It works exceptionally well when the quad is moving forward at EXACTLY the angle specified in the GUI.  

The problem, however,  is that the quad is almost never traveling at the exact specified angle set in the GUI.  Pitch is dynamic and therefore the effective compensatory angle is also dynamic.

A more accurate compensatory angle needs to take into account not only the fixed camera angle but also the pitch of the quad.  

For example, when flying a fast quad with very high camera tilt on the race course in a tight, slow section where the quad is moving slower and flying at low pitch (lower than the angle of camera tilt set in the GUI), the quad is essentially over-corrected.  This leads to increased visual perceptual error and makes slower or more technical sections of the race course more difficult to fly.  At higher speeds and higher tilt angles it is not generally a problem.

Personally, I have found setting the compensatory angle in the GUI at about half or a little less than half of the actual camera angle to give the best results on a race quad, as that seems to be a fairly good average for a flight that requires constantly changing pitch.  But, it could be so much better. 

THE PROPOSED ENHANCEMENT(S):
1.  Since the flight controller is already monitoring the pitch angle, make the FPV camera compensation angle a dynamic number that takes into account actual pitch.   This would provide the most accurate correction at any pitch angle.

(fixed camera angle) + or - (actual pitch angle of the quad) = Applied compensation angle

2.  A simpler but less perfect approach could be to change the compensation angle base on throttle, as throttle and pitch are generally proportional in a forward moving quad.  
Less throttle = less pitch = less compensation.  and vice versa.  I could see this working well within the first 60-70% of the throttle curve (perhaps that could be configurable, too.)

(FPV Camera Compensation angle) X (throttle %) = Applied compensation angle

Thank you developers for your consideration.  I truly appreciate everything you do.  I hope this will at least lead to a fruitful discussion.

title: Replace RC_SMOOTHING_RATE with proper debug streams

labels.name: Pinned
labels.description: Pinned items are excluded from automatically being marked as stale

body:
Currently, the `RC_SMOOTHING_RATE` debug stream is made up of a mishmash of measurements based on data input and measurements based on RX task timings.
This makes it impossible to use this stream for anything except for RC smoothing tuning.

This should be replaced with two debug streams, `RC_INPUT_RATE` and `RC_TASK_RATE` to track one distinct set of measurements each.

This will allow users to use these debug values without having to worry about what measurements they represent.

If needed, amalgamation of `RC_INPUT_RATE` and `RC_TASK_RATE` into a mixed data stream can be done on the client side.
